availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on February 20, 1817. Worked as a Lawyer in Lexington in the decades prior to the Civil War. Married Julia Genevive Warfield. Hunt acted as a Commissioner from Kentucky to Abraham Lincoln to request the removal of troops from Kentucky in 1861. Died on April 2, 1879.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "Francis Key Hunt (Februart 20, 1817 - April 2, 1879)," Memorial #99686345, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=HUN&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=1521&GRid=99686345& (accessed June 13, 2017); Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2, p. 199B; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 1, p. 483; Z. F. Smith, The History of Kentucky (Louisville: Courier-Journal Job Printing Company, 1892), 611-612.
